name: California Poppy
overview: The California Poppy is an annual plant. The leaves are alternately divided into round, lobed segments. The flowers, which have four petals that can range from yellow to red to orange, grow on the end of the long, silky textured stems. They flower from February to September and the flowers close at night and open when the sun is out.
habitat: Native to the Pacific slope of North America, from Western Oregon to Baja California.  The seed were introduced into the English garden in the 19th century. It is seen along roadsides, empty lots, and other places. They can be either wild or not.
size: Ranges between 4 inches to 12 inches tall
